You can see how the captured substances changes the filter color all the way through and even if you've never smoked to see this proof first hand, there is plenty of videos all over the internet that filters do make a difference. Hell for a long time Doctors and scientists argued that unfiltered Marijuana has more breathing affects than filtered cigarettes. And yes even if it does take some time, they are biodegradable, less than 10 years for something that is not a living organism to decompose is actually a relatively short amount of time compared to other nonoganisms, especially in the grand scale of Earth's life span. Im just saying that there is much bigger and worse environmental problems then some paper filters laying around. normally i like this channel alot but I feel like the maker of this video is really uneducated in the subject and is doing the opposite of what he said in the beginning and just used his personal opinion and "knowledge" on the subject to throw in some facts that sounded good just to make it sound like he wasn't ripping on smokers like he said. At least they do actually break down over time. Don’t get me started on fast food styrofoam. I’m sure you feel the same way. No one, absolutely no one should be smoking store bought cigarettes today. They are only composed of Aprox. 50% tobacco. The rest is chemically treated paper that is shredded to appear like tobacco. The majority of the absolute horror chemicals are found in the synthetic tobacco that is added. This is how manufacturers are able to play with nicotine levels creating higher addiction rates, added ammonia to help the lungs absorb nicotine, cut costs from having to fill the entire cigarette with tobacco and so much more. I started smoking at the very end of it being cool to smoke in the 1970’s being just under 13 years old. Smoked 1-2 packs a day since I was 16. That’s over 35 years for me. My lungs are completely shot, catching my breath just mowing the lawn is almost impossible and I’m about to hit the point where people start oxygen. Still after all of this I just can’t quit. Everyone is different but for so many of us it’s virtually impossible. DO NOT EVER START! And for all those smokers out there, if you can’t quite at least buy organic tobacco and make your own “with filters”. You can make the equivalent to American Spirits for only 70 cents a pack and they don’t taste nasty like the spirits do. Different blends of tobacco taste different just like coffee beans. Last semester I did a life cycle assessment comparing the environmental impact of cigarettes to e cigarettes. On top of the pollution and the seeping of nicotine and carcinogens into the environment, there are also a lot of concerns around farming tobacco. Tobacco is extremely water intensive and leads to deforestation in a lot of countries where food security is generally low (it takes 55 times the amount of water to grow tobacco as it would a tomato). The world health organization claims that this, along with the impact of creating the paper and curing the tobacco and the adverse health effects of smoking on the health of people in these countries (where health care can be difficult to access) makes them a net negative on the economies of those countries.

Most people would probably agree with this. Anyways, they’re banning ecigs because of a substance called THC, which is found in some drugs such as weed and marijuana. Some vapor pens do contain cbd, a chemical that relaxes the body, but at the moment deaths that were publicized have been mostly because of thc. Now thc isn’t exactly legal yet, and therefore are a completely separate product from things such as vape pens, juul pens, and eliquids. When people “vape” thc products, it’s basically disguising themselves to show that they’re vaping, while they’re basically doing weed. Many companies have suffered from this ban. Now how does any of this connect to cigarettes? Well, for a while now, many smokers have been going to ecigs and juul products in order to get the nicotine satisfaction they got while smoking. Originally, they were supposed to start lowering the amount of nic every month until they got to 0 by changing the eliquid and then throwing the juul away. Some people were able to quit both, some people are still hooked up on vaping, but either would probably be healthier than smoking. Now though, the people stuck on vaping will go back to smoking, and the people planning to start vaping to stop smoking will keep smoking, therefore raising the death tolls and amount of people in poverty. More people in poverty would mean less people buying from any business in order to keep buying cigarettes. That’d also mean more people robbing both big and small companies, therefore hurting the businesses. I know this turned into a 5 paragraph essay real quick but I had to get my opinion out.
